items.title: Date-picker: v11 audit
items.body:
## Audit
A designer and developer will pair on this audit, some tasks may be discipline focused. Follow the checklist below for the features and items to review. If there are no issues with the item then check the item as complete. If any problems or bugs come up when auditing add a comment to this issue with the problem and how to correct it (if you know how). Bugs do not need to be fixed while auditing. 

## Resources
- [Design spec in Sketch](https://ibm.box.com/s/v4hk50eol2wkurvtxz295kw6pz094lq5)
- [V11 Website](https://v11.carbondesignsystem.com/)
- [SCSS](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon/tree/next/packages/components/src/components)
- [Storybook](https://carbon-react-next.netlify.app/?path=/story/getting-started-welcome--welcome)


## Checklist

**Visual** (in React code) 
_Design and dev check_
- [ ] Component is using the correct design tokens (color and type), see design spec and scss code.
- [x] Component is rendering correctly across themes and layers, see design spec and storybook.
    - [ ] White theme
    - [ ] Gray 10 theme
    - [ ] Gray 90 theme
    - [ ] Gray 100 theme

_Update: bugs found, see comments below_

- [ ] Component is rendering correctly across browsers (check themes across browsers as well), see storybook.
    - [x] Firefox
    - [x] Safari
    - [x] Chrome
- [x] Component sizes are rendering and named correctly ([if applicable](https://v11.carbondesignsystem.com/migrating/guide/develop#size-prop-updates-breaking))

 **Website** (v11)
 _Design checks_
- [x] Style tab has correct design tokens listed 
- [x] Style and usage tabs are using the correct [size props](https://v11.carbondesignsystem.com/migrating/guide/design#sizing) names (if applicable)
- [x] Usage tab is up-to-date for with any [v11 behavioral](https://v11.carbondesignsystem.com/migrating/guide/develop#changelog) changes (if any)
- [ ] Live Demo has applied v11 changes
   - [ ] Themes are rendering correctly
   - [ ] Size props are named correctly
   - [ ] No `light` props included

**Design Kits** (Sketch only)
 _Design checks_
- [x] Correct design tokens (type and color) are used
- [x] Component using the correct size prop names
- [x] Any additional v11 behaviors have been added

**Storybook**
 _Dev checks_
- [x] Confirm that prop table is populating 
- [ ] Take note of missing examples/stories (if any)

**React package**
 _Dev checks_
- [ ] Go to https://codesandbox.io/s/github/carbon-design-system/carbon/tree/main/packages/react/examples/codesandbox and confirm that you can use the component as expected from `@carbon/react` 

**Accessibility** 
 _Dev checks_
- [x] Confirm that there are no violations in Accessibility checker
- [x] Confirm that component works as expected with VoiceOver

**Migration docs**
_Design and dev check_
- [ ] Any breaking changes to this component are present in the v11 [migration guide](https://v11.carbondesignsystem.com/migrating/guide/overview).
   - [ ] Design
   - [ ] Develop - partially checked. The size prop and className prop have been documented but there is no documentation for the component moving from a class to a function

items.title: Date Picker reset
items.body: ## Summary We're incorporating a date picker into our design and would like to provide the ability to "clear" or "reset" whatever a user has selected. Right now, we have a clear button show up below the date picker but this pushes the items down. We're wondering if this is the best solution or if there are other ways with icons or something inline with the date picker to better support this action. ## Relevant information Example

items.title: [Feature Request]: Date picker component enhancement: combined date and time picker
items.body:
### Summary

We're seeking an approved proposal to enhance Carbon's `date picker` component to support combined date and time inputs within the same fields.

This enhancement to `date picker` would be useful for when users need to filter down data between a specific date and time. It would also minimize the amount of space needed to display `time picker` and `single with calendar` side by side, while also creating a mental connection to help our users to understand which date corresponds to which time. 

| With AM & PM | Without AM & PM | 
| ----------- | ----------- | 
| ![date picker with meridiem](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29249866/143887374-5ac4ce4d-1a9f-4446-b8fa-7d59e0de9b09.gif) | ![date picker without meridiem](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29249866/143887428-3074788c-0950-4370-bed1-a8ad6b1410fa.gif) | 




### Justification

While date picker (and it's variants) work for many use cases, we've noticed that they can become overbearing when shown side by side when used to ask the user for a date and time range. In addition, when `date picker` is currently implemented, a visual disconnect is created between the date and the relevant time. 

| Current Process |
| ----------- | 
| ![Current Implementation](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29249866/143884015-0c307bec-cfaf-4dbf-ad3b-cfb780537c17.png) |

| Process with Proposed Enhancement |
| ----------- | 
| ![Proposal](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29249866/143884142-c1274c21-136c-40ed-8908-54bc04fcd95c.png) | 

Since this would be an enhancement on top of `date picker's` current offering, we are reaching out for development assistance.

### Desired UX and success metrics

The combined date and time enhancement to `Date picker` will provide a visual indicator for users to choose a date and a corresponding time. It's functionality should mirror Carbon's current `date picker` and `time picker`, as it just has been combined into one smaller component.

**Success metrics:**

- Users should be able to identify the ability to select a date from a calendar and its corresponding time.
- Change the way a calendar is displayed based on their pre-defined IBM Cloud settings. (A user in Ireland would likely not use AM or PM, thus they should be shown `Date and Time Picker without Meridiem`.
- Warn users when their choice invalid.

### Required functionality

The required functionality should mirror what is currently seen on [the documentation for Date Picker.](https://www.carbondesignsystem.com/components/date-picker/usage) However, one added requirement would be changing the way `time picker` and `date picker` are displayed based on a users predefined settings on IBM Cloud.

A user in Ireland would likely not use AM or PM, thus they should be shown `Date and Time Picker without Meridiem`.

### Specific timeline issues / requests

Three users have asked us for this refined functionality in the past two months. While there is no defined deadline, it would be nice to have as an option. We'd love to work with Carbon to make this happen.

### Available extra resources

Design resources: our team can create usage and style templates, create additional guidance, and help bring this to life!

Development resources: A developer has agreed to work with Cloud PAL to contribute this as an enhancement to Carbon.

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon/blob/f555616971a03fd454c0f4daea184adf41fff05b/.github/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)

items.title: Date picker - custom range focus state issue

labels.name: severity: 4
labels.description: Affects minor functionality, no workaround needed

items.body:
## Overview
Date picker - custom range focus state issue: Currently, the focus (blue border) goes back to the start date after user finishes choosing their end date. 

## Detailed description

What version of the Carbon Design System are you using?
Carbon 10

What did you expect to happen?
Focus should stay on the end date after user chooses the end date 

What happened instead?
The focus goes back to the start date after user finishes choosing their end date

## Steps to reproduce the issue
Using [storybook](https://react.carbondesignsystem.com/?path=/story/components-datepicker--range) component as an example 

1. Select start date (focus starts on start date) 
2. Select end date (focus starts on end date and when end date is selected, focus ends on start date) 

## Additional information
This is the expected behavior after user chooses their start and end date. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/93011195/139329643-1c72df47-9e4d-44c8-b0ce-204f7aa5781a.png)

items.title: 'Today' or 'Current' button on date picker
items.body:
### Summary

On the date picker, it would be nice to have an option to quickly navigate to the current date. 

### Justification

We have had a number of customers request this in our software, but it looks like it's not currently supported in Carbon 10.

### Desired UX and success metrics

I don't mind about the interface - just that there is a way to navigate back to 'today' with one click. Most date pickers seem to do this with a 'today' button under the calendar.

items.title: [Feature Request]: Date picker should not open on focus (or make it optional)
items.body:
### Summary

Currently, DatePicker opens _on focus_. Change the behaviour of DatePicker so it does not open on focus but instead only opens when the user interacts with it, either by clicking on the field with the mouse or pressing the down-arrow while the field is focussed.

If this can't/shouldn't be the default then make it optional e.g. a `focusOpens` prop that when set to false behaves as I've described.

### Justification

When the date picker input field is the first field in a modal dialog it is focussed automatically (as per [web authoring standards](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices-1.1/#keyboard-interaction-7)) when the modal opens and thus the picker opens also, which is unexpected, annoying, distracting and can obscure some of the content of the modal.

Also, when tabbing through a large form, such as when skipping over optional fields, or navigating to a field to correct an error, if the user tabs through one or several date picker fields, this is annoying and distracting, adding cognitive load.

### Desired UX and success metrics

- User satisfaction
- Form completion time/error rate

### Required functionality

Change the behaviour of DatePicker so it does not open on focus but instead only opens when the user interacts with it, either by clicking on the field with the mouse or pressing the down-arrow while the field is focussed.

### Specific timeline issues / requests

_No response_

### Available extra resources

Front-end developers

items.title: Can't select Date when opening picker results in scroll bar

labels.name: severity: 4
labels.description: Affects minor functionality, no workaround needed

labels.name: impact: low
labels.description: Affects one or a few users

items.body:
I was able to reproduce this using the Carbon Story book  https://react.carbondesignsystem.com/?path=/story/datepicker--single

1.  Click the button to open the canvas in new tab
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30597411/96450003-a6e1db00-11e3-11eb-9851-91fb5e33b97a.png)

2.  Decrease the size of the window so the calendar appears fully but such that the calendar popup doesn't have room to open.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30597411/96450151-d264c580-11e3-11eb-8013-bcddccd0b469.png)

3.  Click on the calendar image so the calendar popup opens.  This causes a scrollbar to appear.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30597411/96450266-f88a6580-11e3-11eb-982d-ec1ec9f42536.png)

4.  Dates at the end of the month are not visible, so use the scroll bar to to try to scroll the date into view.

Every time you go to the scrollbar, the popup loses focus and closes.  You can't select dates that are scrolled out of view.

Workaround:  Use the scroll wheel on the mouse, which does not cause focus to be lost.  However, I don't think all of our users are aware of the scroll wheel.
